name: Lasagna Roll Ups
author: BETTIE
summary: This is a good freeze and eat later meal.  It uses tofu, but you'd never know it!  My cooking co-op loved this recipe! You can individually freeze the roll ups on a cookie sheet and place in a freezer bag.
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach - thawed, drained and squeezed dry
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook lasagna noodles for 5 to 8 minutes, or until just slightly underdone; drain and rinse
In a large mixing bowl, mix together grated cheese, ricotta cheese, tofu,  frozen spinach, and 1 cup Parmesan cheese
Spread a layer of the cheese mixture on the noodle, then add a thin layer of sauce
Roll the noodle up, and place seam side down in a 13x9 pan
Top with remaining sauce and Parmesan cheese
Bake in a preheated 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven  for 30 min, or until hot and bubbly
